articles.author: Ben Ezeamalu
articles.description: One morning in June, an ocean surge swept through the village of Apakin, one of Lagos' last indigenous coastal communities, washing away fishing boats, nets and graves. It was only the latest event in the settlement of roughly 3,000 people that is losing homes and livelihoods to rising seas.
articles.title: Coastal surges sweep away Nigeria coastal community as Commonwealth promise stalls
